channel.title: Java connection ports

item.title: Java connection ports
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:18, topic:554402”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=673326.msg4502434#msg4502434 date=1452856487]

Your VoteHandler class expects no arguments in the constructor, like so:

You have supplied 2 arguments.

^1 error.
Second error:
The method “authenticate” doesn’t exist in the votehandler api.

[size=1pt]but yet you’ve worked on this source for 2 years[/size]

This doesn’t make any sense at all it supported it before this stuff happened how can it not now?

Errors don’t magically occur, you changed something in some shape or form that caused it to.

I feel like this particular error is because you’re using the wrong vote jar for your server.
(AKA: The code is for one API, and you have another one in your deps folder)
[/quote]

I understand they don’t just happen, and what do you mean i have another one in deps folder? I can’t be using wrong vote jar for the server cause i got it off the website with the same tutorial, and as i said before it was working fine. but the other one ur talking about is it the one in the pic?[/quote]
No the stuff you have highlighted in the pic is unrelated.
The one that’s related is the one that’s clearly named “voteHandler”

It is possible you got a newer version of the API and followed an older tutorial

Read full topic

item.title: Java connection ports
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:11, topic:554402”]If it’s not in your projects /libs/ folder with the rest of the .jars, then you download netty from their website and add it.

Then in eclipse expand the libs folder (Refresh the project after its added to the folder), right click the netty jar, and add to build path.[/quote]

I actually found it and here are some errors from the compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Java connection ports
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If it’s not in your projects /libs/ folder with the rest of the .jars, then you download netty from their website and add it.

Then in eclipse expand the libs folder (Refresh the project after its added to the folder), right click the netty jar, and add to build path.

Read full topic

item.title: Java connection ports
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You messed something up when loading the project into eclipse, it appears.

Open the project configuration (Right click it, build path, configure build path option).

Make sure your netty jar is in there.

item.title: Java connection ports
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Show the rest of the error. You cut it off at the most vital information (the above part).

[code]/**
* Main server tick.
*/
scheduler.schedule(new Task() {
@Override
protected void execute() {
itemHandler.process();
playerHandler.process();
npcHandler.process();
shopHandler.process();
CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().process();
objectManager.process();
fightPits.process();
pestControl.process();
}
});

}

/**
 * Logging execution.
 */
public static boolean playerExecuted = false;

/**
 * Gets the sleep mode timer and puts the server into sleep mode.
 */
public static long getSleepTimer() {
	return sleepTime;
}

/**
 * Gets the Graphics manager.
 */
public static StillGraphicsManager getStillGraphicsManager() {
	return stillGraphicsManager;
}

/**
 * Gets the Player manager.
 */
public static PlayerManager getPlayerManager() {
	return playerManager;
}

/**
 * Gets the Object manager.
 */
public static ObjectManager getObjectManager() {
	return objectManager;
}

/**
 * Java connection. Ports.
 */
private static void bind() {
	ServerBootstrap serverBootstrap = new ServerBootstrap(
			new NioServerSocketChannelFactory(
					Executors.newCachedThreadPool(),
					Executors.newCachedThreadPool()));
					serverBootstrap.setPipelineFactory(new PipelineFactory(
					new HashedWheelTimer()));
					serverBootstrap.bind(new InetSocketAddress(serverlistenerPort));
}

public static TaskScheduler getScheduler() {
	return scheduler;
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Java connection ports
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

How can this be fixed…?

[code]/**
* Java connection. Ports.
*/
private static void bind() {
ServerBootstrap serverBootstrap = new ServerBootstrap(
new NioServerSocketChannelFactory(
Executors.newCachedThreadPool(),
Executors.newCachedThreadPool()));
serverBootstrap.setPipelineFactory(new PipelineFactory(
new HashedWheelTimer()));
serverBootstrap.bind(new InetSocketAddress(serverlistenerPort));
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
